Legal_Issue: Whether 'Winchester Gold' is confusingly similar to 'Molson Golden'
Legal_Provision: Sections 6(5) and 38(2)(d) of the Trademarks Act
Legal_Rule: A trademark is not registrable if it is likely to be confused with a prior registered or well-known mark
Procedural_Stage: Appeal from Trademark Opposition Board decision
Procedural_Issue: Standard of review in trademark appeal
Decision_Authority: Registrar of Trademarks, confirmed by Court
Evidence_Assessment: Market evidence and state of the register considered
Key_Evidence_Considered: Similarity of marks, reputation of 'Molson Golden', consumer perception
Evidence_Type: Market evidence, registration records, comparative analysis
Defendant_Response: Labatt argued 'Winchester Gold' is inherently distinctive and not confusing
Grounds_for_Claim: Likelihood of confusion due to similarity in name and product class
Credibility_Factor: Strength of 'Winchester Gold' as a coined term
